channel.title: Nat Thiever and High Alcher
channel.description:
I Don't expect there to be too many testers. But any [size=14pt]feedback[/size] and [size=14pt]help[/size] would be appreciated.
This script will high alch twice, then steal a nature rune from the chest in Ardougne. Then, High Alch 3 times...and Steal another nature rune. <---(Repeats this) (The chest on the second floor in the first building directly east of the thieving square).
No Anti-randoms have been added. Even though I havn't been caught yet, this script is very detectable so far.
[size=24pt]Currently Working On:[/size] [size=18pt]*Learning Bitmaps[/size] [size=18pt]*Insterting In A Form[/size] [size=18pt]*Getting It Ready For SRL's 7 Rules.[/size]

item.title: Nat Thiever and High Alcher
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Del Oro, post:4, topic:15409”]EDIT: If I want to double check the click using color spiral is the code…

If Findcolorspiral(x,y,COLOR,x1,y1,x2,y2)then; Mouse(x,y,2,2,True)else; Findcolorspiral(x,y,COLOR2,x1,y1,x2,y2)then; Mouse(x,y,2,2,True);[/quote]

It should be
[scar]
if(FindColorSpiral(x, y, color, x1, y1, x2, y2)) then Mouse(x, y, 2, 2, True);
else if(FindColorSpiral(x, y, color2, x1, y1, x2, y2)) then Mouse(x, y, 2, 2, True);
[/scar]

ALWAYS put a parenthesis after if, while, for, etc.
NEVER put semicolon after then.
If the “then” statement takes up more than one line (like what you did), then make it like this:
[scar]
if(FindColorSpiral(x, y, color, x1, y1, x2, y2)) then
begin
Mouse(…);
TouchMe(…);
end;
[/scar]

TRY to capitalize words inside the name of a function (FindColorSpiral instead of Findcolorspiral) and put spaces after commas, because it makes it look that much more professional.

I dont think you capitalize if, then, else, for, while, procedure, (anything bolded in scar), but I could be wrong.

IF YOU HAVE THE TIME, look at other scripts and see how everything works. Thats how I learn.

Read full topic

item.title: Nat Thiever and High Alcher
item.dc:creator: @Del_Oro Del Oro
item.description:
@Del_Oro wrote:

[quote=“yohojo, post:3, topic:15409”]Please dont make any more RUNESCAPE scripts until you learn to use srl
beacsue all of the procedures like movemousesmooth and clickmouse are very detectable

This inst a flame
its CONSTRUCTIVE CRITICIZM[/quote]

No flame taken. Thanks for the help, guys.
I knew that movemousesmooth and clickmouse are both very detectable,
but I didn’t know how to insert other things.
So, I’m working on the script right now.
I’ll post the update soon. Keep up the [size=12pt]Constructive Criticizm.[/size]

Also, can I add SRL anti-randoms, etc. Without being a SRL member?
Of course, I have the latest SRL.
Thanks Lots.

EDIT: If I want to double check the click using color spiral is the code…

If Findcolorspiral(x,y,COLOR,x1,y1,x2,y2)then; Mouse(x,y,2,2,True)else; Findcolorspiral(x,y,COLOR2,x1,y1,x2,y2)then; Mouse(x,y,2,2,True);

Read full topic

item.title: Nat Thiever and High Alcher
item.dc:creator: @yohojo yohojo
item.description:
@yohojo wrote:

Movemousesmoth and clickmouse are VERY detectable.
Learn to use srl and use some on those mouse fucntions instead
also dont make it click same cordiantes over and over
try to use color
Also to open any tabs (like magic tab)
use tis
[scar]Gametab(7)[/scar]
And as for oclors
[scar]If Findcolorspiral(x,y,COLOR,x1,y1,x2,y2)then
Mouse(x,y,2,2,true)[/scar]
that loks for a color and then clicsk it with the SRL “mouse procedure”

Please dont make any more RUNESCAPE scripts until you learn to use srl
beacsue all of the procedures like movemousesmooth and clickmouse are very detectable

This inst a flame
its CONSTRUCTIVE CRITICIZM

Read full topic

item.title: Nat Thiever and High Alcher
item.dc:creator: @dickiebird dickiebird
item.description:
@dickiebird wrote:

As it stands I would say this script is uber detectable, try randomising the coordinates and wait and using hold/release mouse instead of click mouse. Nice idea though.

Post here and i’ll try help you with this if needs be.

Read full topic
